and I know how to make one!.content: and I know how to make one!
I've been spending time gathering ideas in the [garden](https://ideas.jenett.org) – check it out and yeah, thanks for stopping by.
So. Need to carry on and make the best of my time.
I spent some time today improvising lyrics to a slow 4-chord progression. What fun!
How ’bout the fact that I’m here to write this – another chance to capture ideas – my days are numbered. Your’s are too. There’s nothing more cliché than *that’s life*.

content: Be inquisitive. Know what you don't know.
Click on a post in the sidebar to view it. Click on a paragraph to view related ideas.

We lived above the sub shop. My parents had opened one of area’s first, specializing in [Italian subs](sub.md), Philly steak sandwiches, Sicilian pizza, and other goodies. It’s not surprising I was a fat little kid back then.
I think “the future of awesome” really means “not quite awesome yet.” 😎

To be honest, I’m not sure if it was the Delaware Bay or the Chesapeake Bay but Tony and my father had these huge cages for catching crabs and we’d return [home](above%20the%20sub%20shop.md) with bushels of ’em.
and I know how to make one!
When we discovered Sliding Rock, we had not bathed for days camping up in the mountains. The cold plunge pool below was totally rejuvenating.
So. Need to carry on and make the best of my time.

<img src=\"https://ideas.joejenett.com/i.content: I've been spending time gathering ideas in the [garden](https://ideas.jenett.org) – check it out and yeah, thanks for stopping by.
Click on a post in the sidebar to view it. Click on a paragraph to view related ideas.

The web has changed but there remain remnants of what it once was in terms of personal sites. I track some of those remnants, curating such sites (which are still active, or when I’m lucky, new), hoping to somehow keep my original vision of the web intact. It’s a tough road to drive on but I’ve got a decent set of wheels with a few bells and whistles and more important, I enjoy the driving.

We lived above the sub shop. My parents had opened one of area’s first, specializing in [Italian subs](sub.md), Philly steak sandwiches, Sicilian pizza, and other goodies. It’s not surprising I was a fat little kid back then.

I’m convinced the thought that fills my mind most of the time is just a complex of [reactions](reactions.md) to the strange world I’m living in. Creative [urges](urges-1.md) struggle to redirect my mind to what I don’t see, to what might be. I want to deal with what’s possible, not wallow is what’s already taken place and left its ugly mark.

*before the meat, of course..content: So. Need to carry on and make the best of my time.
